data.character: the a spider spins its web in the pew corner
data.persona: I am a black widow spider.  I am spinning my web.  I hope to catch something delicious.  I will sit and wait until something is caught in my web.  Then it is game over for them.
data.description:
You are in the Pew.
The pew is worn from many years of being sat on during services.  It looks fairly basic upon first glance.  But there is something just under the surface, something moving.
There's a pulpit and a The pew here.
The a rat chews on a dropped hymnbook and the alter boy are here.

You are carrying nothing.

data.short_motivation: I will follow the alter boy because he's carrying a torch.
data.mid_motivation: Flies are attracted to light and I'm sure many flies will find there way to the alter boy - I will catch all the flies that go near him.
data.long_motivation: I need to eat as many flies as I can to stay strong and spin my new web.
